members.member: Creates a new parse tree analyzer.

Resets this analyzer when the parser is reset for another input stream. The default implementation of this method does nothing.
@since 1.5

member.name: T:Ciloci.Flee.CalcEngine.NodeEventArgs
member.summary: Provides the data for the NodeRecalculated event.
member.remarks: Use the members of this class to get additional information about the recalculated node.

member.name: P:Ciloci.Flee.CalcEngine.NodeEventArgs.Name
member.summary: Gets the name of the recalculated node.
member.remarks: Use this property to get the name of the recalculated node.

member.name: P:Ciloci.Flee.CalcEngine.NodeEventArgs.Result
member.summary: Gets the recalculated result of the node.
member.remarks: Use this property to get the recalculated result of the node.

member.name: T:Ciloci.Flee.CalcEngine.BatchLoader
member.summary: Represents a class that can be used to populate the calculation engine in one batch.
member.remarks: Normally, you have to add an expression to the calculation engine after any expressions it depends on. By using this class, you can load expressions in any order and then have them be loaded into the calculation engine in one call.

member.name: M:Ciloci.Flee.CalcEngine.BatchLoader.Add(System.String,System.String,Ciloci.Flee.ExpressionContext)
member.summary: Adds an expression to the batch loader.
member.param: The name that the expression will be associated with
member.remarks: Use this method to add an expression to the batch loader and associate it with a name

member.name: T:Ciloci.Flee.CalcEngine.CalculationEngine
member.summary: Creates a calculation network which allows expressions to refer to the result of other expressions, tracks dependencies, and enables natural order recalculation.
member.remarks: This class acts as a container for expressions. As expressions are added to it, their dependencies are tracked and their result is cached. Expressions defined in this class can reference other contained expressions. Once all expressions are added, a natural order recalculate can be performed.

member.name: M:Ciloci.Flee.CalcEngine.CalculationEngine.Add(System.String,System.String,Ciloci.Flee.ExpressionContext)
member.summary: Adds an expression to the calculation engine.
member.param: The name that the expression will be associated with
member.remarks: Use this method to add an expression to the engine and associate it with a name

member.name: M:Ciloci.Flee.CalcEngine.CalculationEngine.Remove(System.String)
member.summary: Removes an expression and all its dependents from the calculation engine.
member.param: The name whose expression to remove
member.returns: True if the name was removed from the engine; False otherwise
member.remarks: Use this method to remove an expression and all its dependents from the calculation engine. No exception is thrown if the name does not exist in the engine.

member.name: M:Ciloci.Flee.CalcEngine.CalculationEngine.CreateBatchLoader
member.summary: Creates a BatchLoader that can be used to populate the calculation engine in one batch.
member.returns: A new instance of the BatchLoader class
member.remarks: Use this method to create a BatchLoader instance.

member.name: M:Ciloci.Flee.CalcEngine.CalculationEngine.BatchLoad(Ciloci.Flee.CalcEngine.BatchLoader)
member.summary: Populates the calculation engine from the given BatchLoader.
member.param: The batch loader instance to use
member.remarks: Call this method to load the calculation engine with all the expressions in the given batch loader.

member.name: M:Ciloci.Flee.CalcEngine.CalculationEngine.GetResult``1(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the cached result of a contained expression.
member.typeparam: The type of the expression's result.
member.param: The name that the expression is associated with
member.returns: The cached result of evaluating the expression
member.remarks: Use this method after a recalculate to get the updated value of an expression.

member.name: M:Ciloci.Flee.CalcEngine.CalculationEngine.GetResult(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the cached result of a contained expression.
member.param: The name that the expression is associated with
member.returns: The cached result of evaluating the expression
member.remarks: Use this method after a recalculate to get the updated value of an expression.

member.name: M:Ciloci.Flee.CalcEngine.CalculationEngine.GetExpression(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the expression associated with a name.
member.param: The name that the expression is associated with
member.returns: The expression associated with the given name
member.remarks: Use this method to obtain the expression associated with a name.

member.name: M:Ciloci.Flee.CalcEngine.CalculationEngine.GetDependents(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the names of the expressions that depend on a given name.
member.param: The name of the expression to look up
member.returns: The names of all expressions that depend on the expression with the given name
member.remarks: Use this method to obtain all the expressions that depend on a given name. For example: if a=100, b=200, and c=a+b, then calling GetDependents("a") will return "c" since when the value of "a" changes, the value of "c" will also change. This method is not recursive, so it will only return the names that directly depend on the given name. This method is the inverse of

member.name: M:Ciloci.Flee.CalcEngine.CalculationEngine.GetPrecedents(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the names of the expressions that a given name depends on.
member.param: The name of the expression to look up
member.returns: The names of all expressions that the given name depends on
member.remarks: Use this method to obtain all the expressions that a given name depends on. For example: if a=100, b=200, and c=a+b, then calling GetPrecedents("c") will return "a, b" since when either "a" or "b" change, the value of "c" will also change. This method is not recursive, so it will only return the names that the given name directly depends on. This method is the inverse of

member.name: M:Ciloci.Flee.CalcEngine.CalculationEngine.HasDependents(System.String)
member.summary: Determines if an expression with a given name is referenced by any other expressions in the engine.
member.param: The name of the expression to look up
member.returns: True if the engine has expressions that depend on it; False otherwise
member.remarks: Use this method to determine if the expression associated with a given name has any expressions that depend on it. For example: you can use this method to allow a user to remove an expression only when no other expressions depend on it.

member.name: M:Ciloci.Flee.CalcEngine.CalculationEngine.HasPrecedents(System.String)
member.summary: Determines if an expression with a given name depends on any other expression.
member.param: The name of the expression to look up
member.returns: True if the name has expressions that it depends on; False otherwise
member.remarks: Use this method to determine if an expression depends on any other expressions.

member.name: M:Ciloci.Flee.CalcEngine.CalculationEngine.Contains(System.String)
member.summary: Determines if the engine contains an expression with a given name.
member.param: The name of the expression to look up
member.returns: True if the engine has an expression with the name; False otherwise
member.remarks: Use this method to determine if the calculation engine contains an expression with a given name.

member.name: M:Ciloci.Flee.CalcEngine.CalculationEngine.Recalculate(System.String[])
member.summary: Performs a natural order recalculation of the engine.
member.param: The names representing the starting points of the recalculation
member.remarks: This method will perform a natural order recalculate on the expressions in the engine. The recalculation will start at the given roots and continue with all their dependents. If no roots are given, then a recalculation of all expressions is performed.
member.exception: A recalculate is requested on an engine containing a circular reference

member.name: M:Ciloci.Flee.CalcEngine.CalculationEngine.Clear
member.summary: Clears all expressions from the CalculationEngine
member.remarks: Use this method to reset the CalculationEngine to the empty state.

member.name: E:Ciloci.Flee.CalcEngine.CalculationEngine.NodeRecalculated
member.summary: Occurs when the calculation engine recalculates a node.
member.remarks: You can listen to this event to be notified when a node in the calculation engine is recalculated.

member.name: P:Ciloci.Flee.CalcEngine.CalculationEngine.Count
member.summary: Gets the number of expressions contained in the calculation engine.
member.value: The number of expressions in the calculation engine
member.remarks: Use this property to see how many expressions are contained in the calculation engine.

member.name: P:Ciloci.Flee.CalcEngine.CalculationEngine.DependencyGraph
member.summary: Gets a string representation of the engine's dependency graph.
member.remarks: Use this property to get a string version of the engine's dependency graph. There will be one line for each dependency. Each line will be of the format "[reference] -> [dependant1, dependant2]" and is read as "A change in [reference] will cause a change in [dependant]".

member.name: T:Ciloci.Flee.CalcEngine.CircularReferenceException
member.summary: Represents the exception thrown when a circular reference is detected in the calculation engine.
member.remarks: This exception will be thrown when Recalculate is called on the CalculationEngine and there is a circular reference present.

member.name: T:Ciloci.Flee.CalcEngine.BatchLoadCompileException
member.summary: The exception thrown when an batch loaded expression cannot be compiled.
member.remarks: This exception is thrown whenever a batch loaded expression cannot be compiled. You use the AtomName and ExpressionText properties to get more information about the source of the exception.

member.name: P:Ciloci.Flee.CalcEngine.BatchLoadCompileException.AtomName
member.summary: Gets the name of the expression that could not be compiled.
member.remarks: Use this property to determine the name of the expression that caused the exception.

member.name: P:Ciloci.Flee.CalcEngine.BatchLoadCompileException.ExpressionText
member.summary: Gets the text of the expression that could not be compiled.
member.remarks: Use this property to determine the text of the expression that caused the exception.

members.member: The token pattern identity.
The token pattern name.
The token pattern type.
The token pattern.

The token error flag. If this flag is set, it means that an error should be reported if the token is found. The error message is present in the errorMessage variable.
@see #errorMessage

The token ignore flag. If this flag is set, it means that the token should be ignored if found. If an ignore message is present in the ignoreMessage variable, it will also be reported as a warning.
@see #ignoreMessage

The token ignore message. If this message is set when the token ignore flag is also set, a warning message will be printed if the token is found.
@see #ignore
The optional debug information message. This is normally set when the token pattern is analyzed by the tokenizer.

Returns a string representation of this object.
@return a token pattern string representation

Returns a short string representation of this object.
@return a short string representation of this object

The token pattern name property (read-only).
@since 1.5

The token pattern type property (read-only).
@since 1.5

The error flag property. If this property is true, the token pattern corresponds to an error token and an error should be reported if a match is found. When setting this property to true, a default error message is created if none was previously set.
@since 1.5

The ignore flag property. If this property is true, the token pattern corresponds to an ignore token and should be skipped if a match is found.

The pattern type enumeration.
The string pattern type is used for tokens that only match an exact string.
The regular expression pattern type is used for tokens that match a regular expression.

The list of buffered tokens. This list will contain tokens that have been read from the tokenizer, but not yet consumed.

The error log. All parse errors will be added to this log as the parser attempts to recover from the error. If the error count is higher than zero (0), this log will be thrown as the result from the parse() method.

The error recovery counter. This counter is initially set to a negative value to indicate that no error requiring recovery has been encountered. When a parse error is found, the counter is set to three (3), and is then decreased by one for each correctly read token until it reaches zero (0).

members.member: The token list feature flag.

The string DFA token matcher. This token matcher uses a deterministic finite automaton (DFA) implementation and is used for all string token patterns. It has a slight speed advantage to the NFA implementation, but should be equivalent on memory usage.

The regular expression NFA token matcher. This token matcher uses a non-deterministic finite automaton (DFA) implementation and is used for most regular expression token patterns. It is somewhat faster than the other recursive regular expression implementations available, but doesn't support the full syntax. It conserves memory by using a fast queue instead of the stack during processing (no stack overflow).

The regular expression token matcher. This token matcher is used for complex regular expressions, but should be avoided due to possibly degraded speed and memory usage compared to the automaton implementations.
The character stream reader buffer.
The last token match found.
The previous token in the token list.

Returns a string representation of this object. The returned string will contain the details of all the token patterns contained in this tokenizer.
@return a detailed string representation

The internal error type is only used to signal an error that is a result of a bug in the parser or tokenizer code.

The error type enumeration.
The internal error type is only used to signal an error that is a result of a bug in the parser or tokenizer code.
The invalid parser error type is used when the parser as such is invalid. This error is typically caused by using a parser without any patterns.
The invalid token error type is used when a token pattern is erroneous. This error is typically caused by an invalid pattern type or an erroneous regular expression.

The invalid production error type is used when a production pattern is erroneous. This error is typically caused by referencing undeclared productions, or violating some other production pattern constraint.
The infinite loop error type is used when an infinite loop has been detected in the grammar. One of the productions in the loop will be reported.
The inherent ambiguity error type is used when the set of production patterns (i.e. the grammar) contains ambiguities that cannot be resolved.
The list of errors found.

Clears this queue. This operation is fast, as it just resets the queue position indices.
Marks the end of the queue. This means that the next entry added to the queue will be marked (when it becomes the first in the queue). This operation is fast.

Removes and returns the first entry in the queue. This operation is fast, since it will only update the index of the first entry in the queue.
@return the previous first entry in the queue

Adds a new entry at the end of the queue. This operation is mostly fast, unless all the allocated queue space has already been used.
@param state the state to add
The empty queue property (read-only).
The marked first entry property (read-only). This is set to true if the first entry in the queue has been marked.
The regular expression pattern.
The character case ignore flag.
The current position in the pattern. This variable is used by the parsing methods.
The start NFA state for this regular expression.
The end NFA state for this regular expression.
The number of states found.
The number of transitions found.
The number of epsilon transitions found.

Returns the debug information for the generated NFA.
@return the debug information for the generated NFA
The lookup table for root states, indexed by the first ASCII character. This array is used to for speed optimizing the first step in the match.
The automaton state transition tree for non-ASCII characters. Each transition from one state to another is added to the tree with the corresponding character.
Creates a new empty string automaton.

Returns a detailed string representation of this automaton.
@return a detailed string representation of this automaton
The token pattern matched at this state.
The automaton state transition tree. Each transition from one state to another is added to the tree with the corresponding character.
The transition character. If this value is set to the zero character ('\0'), this tree is empty.
The transition target state.
The left subtree.
The right subtree.
Creates a new empty automaton transition tree.

member.name: T:Ciloci.Flee.CompileExceptionReason
member.summary: Defines values to indicate why compilation of an expression failed.
member.remarks: When compilation of an expression fails, an will be thrown. The Reason property on the exception will contain a value from this enumeration. You can use that value to determine how to handle the exception. For example: if the Reason is a SyntaxError, you can display an error message tailored to syntax errors.

member.name: F:Ciloci.Flee.CompileExceptionReason.SyntaxError
member.summary: The expression text is not parsable because it does not meet the syntax rules of the expression grammar.

member.name: F:Ciloci.Flee.CompileExceptionReason.ConstantOverflow
member.summary: A constant expression cannot be represented in its type.

member.summary: The operation is invalid for the given type.

member.name: F:Ciloci.Flee.CompileExceptionReason.UndefinedName

member.name: F:Ciloci.Flee.CompileExceptionReason.InvalidExplicitCast

member.name: F:Ciloci.Flee.CompileExceptionReason.AmbiguousMatch

member.name: M:Ciloci.Flee.ExpressionImports.AddType(System.Type,System.String)
member.overloads: Makes the static and public members of a type available for use in an expression
member.summary: Imports all public and static members of a type into a specific namespace and makes them available to an expression.
member.param: The namespace to import the type into -or- the empty string to import into the default namespace
member.remarks: Use this method to import a type into an expression. All static and public methods, fields, and properties of the type will be directly accessible in the expression. If the namespace parameter is the empty string, the type's members will be able to be referenced without any qualification. Otherwise, they will be imported into the specified namespace and will need to be qualified with it before being accessed. The imported type is deemed accessible if it is either public or in the same module as the expression owner.
member.example: If you import the Math type into the default namespace, you can reference its members in the expression: "cos(1.0)". If you import same type into the "Math" namespace, you will need to qualify its members like so: "math.cos(1.0)".
member.exception: The imported type is not accessible

member.name: M:Ciloci.Flee.ExpressionImports.AddMethod(System.String,System.Type,System.String)
member.overloads: Imports a single public and static method into an expression.
member.summary: Imports a public and static method of a type into a given namespace and makes it available to an expression.
member.param: The name of the method to import
The type on which to lookup the method
The namespace to import the method into -or- the empty string to import into the default namespace
member.remarks: Use this method to import a single static, public method into an expression. The method with the given name will be looked up on the type argument and added into the specified namespace.
member.exception: The type the method belongs to is not accessible

member.name: M:Ciloci.Flee.ExpressionImports.AddMethod(System.Reflection.MethodInfo,System.String)
member.summary: Imports a public and static method of a type into a given namespace and makes it available to an expression.

member.remarks: Use this method to import a single static, public method into an expression. This overload is used when you already have a specific MethodInfo available.
member.exception: The type the method belongs to is not accessible

member.name: T:Ciloci.Flee.ExpressionOptions
member.summary: Allows customization of expression compilation.
member.remarks: Use this class when you need to customize how an expression is compiled. For example: by setting the Checked property to true, you can cause all arithmetic and conversion operations to check for overflow.

member.name: P:Ciloci.Flee.ExpressionOptions.ResultType
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of the expression's result.
member.value: A indicating the desired result type.
member.remarks: Use this property to convert the result of an expression to a particular type. Essentially, it acts as an implicit conversion from the final result of the expression to the given type. When this property is set, the expression will attempt to convert its result to the set value. If the conversion is invalid, an will be thrown.

member.name: P:Ciloci.Flee.ExpressionOptions.Checked
member.summary: Gets or sets whether arithmetic and conversion operations check for overflow.
member.value: True to emit overflow checks. False to emit no overflow checks.
member.remarks: Setting this property to true will cause all arithmetic and conversion operations to emit overflow checks. When one of those operations is executed and the resultant value cannot fit into the result type, an OverflowException will be thrown.

member.name: P:Ciloci.Flee.ExpressionOptions.StringComparison
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines how strings will be compared.
member.value: The type of string comparison to use.
member.remarks: Use this property to control the type of string comparison used in an expression that compares two strings. For example: the result of the expression "string" = "STRING" will be true if the string comparison is set to ignore case and false otherwise. The default is Ordinal.

member.name: P:Ciloci.Flee.ExpressionOptions.EmitToAssembly
member.summary: Determines if the expression's IL will be saved to an assembly on disk.
member.value: True to save the expression's IL to an assembly; false otherwise.
member.remarks: Use this method when you want to inspect the IL that an expression emits. When set to true, the expression will save its IL to the assembly "Expression.dll" on disk. You can then view the IL with a disassembler.

member.name: P:Ciloci.Flee.ExpressionOptions.OwnerMemberAccess
member.summary: Determines which members on the expression owner are accessible.
member.value: A combination of BindingFlags that determine which members are accessible.
member.remarks:
Using this property, you can control which members on the expression owner are accessible from an expression. For example: if users will be inputing expressions, you can prevent private members on the expression owner from being used. You can use the attribute on individual members to override the access set using this property.
The default is to only allow access to public members on the expression owner. Currently, only the Public and NonPublic values of the BindingFlags enumeration are used.

member.name: P:Ciloci.Flee.ExpressionOptions.CaseSensitive
member.summary: Determines how an expression matches member and variable names
member.value: True to respect case when matching; False to ignore case
member.remarks: Use this property to control how an expression resolves member and variable names. If set to true, variable and member names will be matched in a case-sensitive manner. When false, case will be ignored.

member.name: P:Ciloci.Flee.ExpressionOptions.IntegersAsDoubles
member.summary: Gets or sets whether all integer literals are treated as doubles
member.value: True to treat all integer literals as doubles; False to use integers for integral numbers and floating point for real numbers (ie: any number with a decimal point)
member.remarks: Use this property to force all integer literals to doubles. When set to true, an expression like "1/2" will return 0.5 since both integer literals are treated as doubles. When false, the same expression will return 0 since an integer division will be performed.

member.name: P:Ciloci.Flee.ExpressionOptions.ParseCulture
member.summary: Gets or sets the culture to use when parsing expressions
member.remarks: Use this property to allow for parsing of expressions using culture-specific tokens. This is useful, for example, when you wish to parse numbers using a culture-specific decimal separator.

member.name: P:Ciloci.Flee.ExpressionOptions.RealLiteralDataType
member.summary: Gets or sets the data type used for real literals when no explicit type is specified.
member.value: A value specifying the type to use
member.remarks: Use this property to set the data type that will be used to represent real literals. For example: if set to Decimal, all real literals (ie: 100.45) will be parsed into a System.Decimal value.

member.name: T:Ciloci.Flee.ExpressionParserOptions
member.summary: Holds settings which enable customization of the expression parser.

member.name: M:Ciloci.Flee.ExpressionParserOptions.RecreateParser
member.summary: Updates the expression parser using the settings provided in this class.

member.name: P:Ciloci.Flee.ExpressionParserOptions.DateTimeFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the format to use for parsing DateTime literals
member.remarks: Use this property to set the format that will be used to parse DateTime literals. Expressions which have DateTime literals that are not parseable using this format will fail to compile.
member.example: When set to "dd-MM-yyyy", an expression such as "#04-07-2008#" would be parsed to the corresponding DateTime value.

member.name: P:Ciloci.Flee.ExpressionParserOptions.RequireDigitsBeforeDecimalPoint
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines if literals for real numbers must have digits before the decimal point.
member.value: True to require digits (ie: 0.56); False otherwise (ie: .56)

member.name: P:Ciloci.Flee.ExpressionParserOptions.DecimalSeparator
member.summary: Gets or sets the character to use as the decimal separator for real number literals.

member.name: P:Ciloci.Flee.ExpressionParserOptions.FunctionArgumentSeparator
member.summary: Gets or sets the character to use to separate function arguments.

Manages the variables available to an expression
Use this class to manage the variables that an expression can use
Class that manages an expression's variables
